channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Barnes & Noble's new Nook tablet will be revealed soon
item.description: The Nook tablet isn't dead -- Barnes & Noble and Lenovo are collaborating on a new device.

item.title: Twitter is 'reviewing' its rules for world leaders
item.description: Twitter will survey users on whether politicians should have to follow the same rules as everyone else.

item.title: New NFL rights deal hands Thursday Night Football to Amazon
item.description: The NFL's new 11-year TV deal includes streaming on Amazon, Peacock, Paramount+ and ESPN+.

item.title: Sony buys Evo esports tournament
item.description: With help from a company called RTS, Sony has bought one of the oldest and longest-running esports tournaments in the world.

item.title: Terraria arrives on Stadia after weeks of uncertainty
item.description: After a tumultuous path to release, indie darling Terraria is now available to play on Google Stadia.

item.title: Square Enix's 'Project Athia' is now 'Forspoken'
item.description: Project Athia has a final name. It's now known as Forspoken, and it's coming out next year.

item.title: Black Panther is coming to 'Marvel's Avengers' later this year
item.description: There's no word on when Spider-Man will arrive on the PS4 and PS5 versions, however.

item.title: The next Life is Strange game is coming to consoles and PC on September 10th
item.description: True Colors features a new cast lead by 21-year-old Alex Chen.

item.title: GeForce Now doubles its price for newcomers to $10 a month
item.description: Existing subscribers can keep paying $5/month for life.

item.title: Twitter test plays YouTube videos directly in its iOS app
item.description: It's a welcome quality-of-life move.

item.title: Oppo's X 2021 prototype shows that rollable phones have potential
item.description: The Oppo X 2021 prototype rollable phone can switch between a conventional 6.7-inch screen and a mini-tablet-like 7.4-inch screen. This is achieved by rolling part of the flexible OLED panel into the back of the phone, which supposedly avoids the creasing issue we've seen on foldables.

item.title: Grammarly's handy tone detector is now available on Android and iOS
item.description: Grammarly's mobile keyboard, available through its iPhone, iPad and Android app, will now analyze the tone of your writing to give you a better sense of how you're coming across.

item.title: Specialized partners with a Tesla co-founder to recycle e-bike batteries
item.description: By all accounts, e-bikes are having a bit of a moment: at one point during the pandemic, sales of powered bicycles outpaced all others by a considerable margin. The appealing of easy, socially distanced rides can be hard to ignore, but the resulting boom in sales has led to a pivotal moment for e-bike makers: What do they do with the batteries once they canâ€™t power rides anymore?

item.title: An 'Animal Crossing' horror short will be made into a full-length movie
item.description: 'Unfriended' producer Timur Bekmambetov is turning 'Don't Peek' into a feature film.

item.title: Facebook adds hardware security key support for Android and iOS
item.description: What has been a security option on desktops since 2017 is now finally available on mobile devices as well.

item.title: Chrome can now caption all audio playing through the browser
item.description: Google is bringing one of its most useful Android accessibility features to Chrome. The company announced today that its browser can now caption any audio and video you play in it.

item.title: Google's plan to block third-party cookies has drawn attention from the DoJ
item.description: There are concerns the move will harm rival ad networks.

item.title: Stella McCartney shows off the world's first clothes made from mushroom leather
item.description: Mylo's mushroom leather offers a far more sustainable alternative to the current plastic-made fake leathers available today.

item.title: Amazon Fire TV's free news app now boasts stations in 88 cities
item.description: Amazon is expanding local coverage on its free news app for Fire TV with over 70 additional stations from Detroit, Phoenix, New Orleans, Salt Lake City, and Orlando, among others.

item.title: Hone your cryptocurrency trading skills with these expert-led classes
item.description: With over 10 hours of instruction on machine language, statistical arbitrage and other quantitative cryptocurrency techniques, this bundle is a great investment for intermediate traders who want to take their investing skills to the next level.

item.title: Every episode of 'The Office' will be free on Peacock for one week
item.description: Peacock has made every episode of 'The Office' free to stream for one week starting on March 18th to both mark the anniversary and boost viewership.

item.title: Google's Threadit is a short-form video platform for work
item.description: Google's Area 120 experimental lab has released a new workplace video app called Threadit to get you sharing short clips with colleagues.

item.title: All the tools you need to make a better podcast
item.description: So you started a podcast? The gear you use can make the difference between someone subscribing or moving onto the next show. In our guide, we give you a host of recommendations to help you take things to the next level.

item.title: Amazon's Rivian-made electric vans start deliveries in San Francisco
item.description: Amazon is now using Rivian's electric vans to deliver packages in San Francisco â€” the first time the EVs have been put to use beyond LA.

item.title: Facebook teases wrist-controlled augmented reality
item.description: Facebook is offering a new peek into how users could ultimately control AR glasses: via their wrists.
